intro: Aciphylla colensoi, commonly known as the Colenso's silver grass, is a perennial shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage. The plant features wiry, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Aciphylla colensoi is well adapted to coastal and rocky environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
